inn1.comm: stepping across the stumps to smother the swing, the ball thuds into the pads but outside the line
back of a length, shaping from leg to off but very slowly off the deck. Defended to the leg side
up on the toes, met outside off stump with a cautious prod
jabbed into the leg side, and off the mark with a scamper to midwicket
attempted leave, fat inside-edge, back goes off stump! Very cagey from Danushka, half forward, tentatively combatting the swing but so much indecision in the space of 22 yards!
angled defence from a probing full length, leaping into the splice and deflected down to third man
decent line and length, outside off and blocked to short cover
standing tall on the back foot, attacking the splice but jabbed back to the bowler
defended off the back foot and punched behind point for a single as Roy dives to gather
clipped off the pads, that's travelling fast to the square leg boundary but Willey makes great ground and drags the ball back in with a despairing dive
width, and smacked off the back foot, supremely placed in front of point. Woakes' extra bounce leaps into the middle of the bat
tapped into the covers
pulls the bat inside the line of a well-directed lifter outside off
shorter, pulled firmly through midwicket
tip and run, finds the gap at short cover
angled into the pads, thuds into the thighpad as Perera attempts to work to leg
tucked up on leg stump once again, a good restrictive line to a batsman who likes to free his arms
firmly drilled into the covers
sharp bouncer, that comes from nowhere and Perera is surprised. Well bowled
punched into the covers
tight line and length, defended back to the bowler
big appeal for lbw but that clearly pitched outside leg. And was probably jagging over the stumps. Well bowled though
punched out to cover
full length, nearly a yorker, swinging away from the left-hander, who stabs down at the crease to defend

punched into the covers off the back foot, superb diving stop from Hales, and that should be a run out! The Sri Lankans were assuming he had been beaten, were running on instinct, and Hales had time to choose his ends before throwing. Inches wide!
more calmly negotiated
that's a jaffa, curling past the outside edge as Mendis plays the line and is thoroughly beaten
tight wicket-to-wicket line from over the wicket to the right hander. Defended to point
up on the toes, defended to cover. England giving nothing away in line
flicked off the pads to short midwicket, and that denies England the thrill of two maidens in a row for the first time this series
beautifully straight batwork, but too straight to steal a run
chopped out to point
on the pads, tucked to midwicket
on the pads to the left-hander this time, turned out to deep midwicket
thrashed off the back foot, aiming square but too square this time. Point tidies up
smeared up and over the covers, and plugs just out of reach of the backpedalling Bairstow! Not the best of strokes, but a bit of a cross-wind helped him clear the fielder. Lucky...
thrashed through the leg-side, a good-looking short-arm jab but not timed to perfection. The leg-side sweeper jogs round to intercept
worked out to deep midwicket
turned to the leg side, scampering through for a single
poked back down the pitch, a sharp single to keep the pot boiling
on the hip, tucked to deep backward square leg.
that's better for Sri Lanka, just enough width to crash a much-needed four through the covers

dug in short, Perera flips a top-edged pull around the corner towards deep backward square, Bairstow scampers in but won't get under it, then slips as he bends down to retrieve the ball and they get back for two
on the stumps, shows it a straight bat coming forwards
touch shorter, 84mph on off stump, punched back to mid-on from the crease
smashed off a length back towards the bowler and he gets his hands up but drops it! Really good effort from Woakes but he couldn't hold on, hit with power and it squirmed out of his grasp
slashes off the back foot towards point, Roy dives and flicks it to Hales at cover point - teamwork in the field from the openers
length around off, tapped down into the covers
very full, attacking the base of off stump. Sharp pace from the outset

full and fast, a foolishly pre-ordained swipe across the line, as if expecting something shorter, but Plunkett's extra zip is onto him before he can get his shot in order. The ball spirals into the sky, plops into Jos Buttler's gloves behind the stumps, and that is a handy breakthrough!
full and straight, a hasty block back down the track
defended into the off side, lifting sharply off the deck. This is quick and accurate so far
clipped to midwicket, thoughts of a single but Chandimal's legs aren't up to such sharp running
defended once again, straight and straighter
tight line, defended
short and lifting outside off, Roy leaps valiantly in the gully but can't quite intercept a lofty back-cut
thumped to cover, on the front foot but not fully timed
driven down the ground to mid-off
shuffles into line to defend to midwicket
flicked to leg, and that's the end of a pretty pedestrian first ten overs from Sri Lanka. Tight bowling
banged in short, sharp work
forward and defended down the ground
very full, maybe even a hint of late swing as it reached the bat. Chiselled out to midwicket either way
sharp again from Plunkett, drags back his length and Mendis wants to pull but is nowhere near the shot
he pulls this time, not entirely convincingly, but gets enough bat on his waft through midwicket as the ball beats wide long-on. Slightly less hostility in that delivery and Plunkett pays the price
good follow-up, full and straight, beats the edge
tight line, clipped to leg
outside off, a bit of width, but keeps low to slide under an attempted slap through the covers
tighter line, lifting off the deck, defended on the back foot for Jordan to collect in his followthrough
wafted off the front pad, a jogged single to square leg
onto the front foot and pushed to cover
outside off, cut to point
wide of off stump, worked down to third man
forward and defended to mid-on
inside-out drive, flashing through square leg
onto the front foot
driven calmly to mid-off
drilled into the covers once again, onto the front foot
big stride, pushed to mid-on
thrashing drive, but can't beat mid-off
tight and straight, respectfully played
clipped in the air, but not quite far enough to carry to short midwicket. Jordan extracting natural variation from a probing length
chopped to backward point
walloped on the up to deep midwicket. Again, no great timing in the stroke, but it keeps the scoreboard moving all the same
tossed onto a good length, a cross-batted hoick to midwicket
loopy line and length, right up to the blockhole, and pushed to cover
a fraction shorter, defended to point
short, and fiercely pulled, but only as far as the leg-side sweeper
up on the toes, driven to wide long-off
short again, and this time he finds the gap, beating the diving Jordan at wide mid-on. Well placed
driven hard to mid-on, and the shy comes in, flicks the non-striker's stumps and deflects all the way past Buttler behind the batsman's stumps! No extra run through
Roy looks to have picked up a carpet-burn from the astroturf after diving to intercept at point
leaning back and cut out to point
defended back down the pitch
clipped to leg, Plunkett's shy is again a bit off the money as Buttler has to scramble to tidy up
tight line, defended into the leg-side
flicked to leg, another quick single
swept aggressively, but not entirely timed
down the track, driven back to the bowler
down on one knee, too full for the slog-sweep but Chandimal just manages to welly it over the head of Jordan at mid-on! Lucky lucky...
tapped to cover and a quick call
back and across to defend

pitched up and punched back down the ground, Chandimal calls for he quick single and he's lucky that Hales throw from mid-on on misses, as he would have been out of his ground at the non-striker's end
length outside off, tapped down towards backward point
touch shorter, rising sharply to hit the splice as Mendis fends to the leg side
half a shout for lbw as Jordan brings the ball back at Mendis, probably heading down the leg side
clubbed over mid-on, not all that short from Jordan but Mendis gets hold of it and clears the fielder on the edge of the ring
dug in and Mendis pulls even more assuredly, sends the ball soaring up and over the boundary at deep midwicket, plopping into the crowd for the first six of the day
floated up around off stump, tapped back to the bowler
pushed through a little wider, steered towards point
slow loopy legbreak, turning away gently outside off as Mendis drops back to cut and picks out extra cover
flatter on the stumps, poked back to the bowler again
low full toss, gets down on one knee and sweeps to deep midwicket - that's his fifty, a nice little knock and responsible for almost two-thirds of SL's runs
Chandimal swats another single through the covers
fullish, Chandi comes forward and dabs one into the covers
bit of width, Mendis drops back and swishes another single to third man
closer to the stumps, tapped down towards short extra cover
good length, hits the seam and jags back as Chandimal aims a big booming drive through the off side, past the inside edge
length ball outside off, pushed in front of square and they hustle through for one
slower ball on the stumps, Mendis works it to mid-on
floated up legbreak outside off stump, Chandimal is down early to sweep
pushed out the front of the hand and Mendis thinks it is short and tries to pull, splices it wide of midwicket
looped up, nice and slow on the stumps, tapped back
sliding on to the pads, Chandimal works it away off his legs for one
tossed up and whipped through midwicket for another single
driven down the ground to long-off
fullish outside off, punched past short extra cover for one

short ball, Mendis takes it on... and sends it sailing straight into the grateful hands of deep square leg! He deserved the praise for a composed fifty but that was a little bit daft from Mendis, trying to shift the scoring rate on but holing out rather tamely in doing so
bends his body forwards over a solid defensive stroke
slower ball, chopped down into the off side
plants the front foot and gets out on off stump to block
tight lines on off, 82mph and Mathews again meets it with a doughty straight blade in defence
pushed through outside off, Chandi attempts to cut and gets a bottom edge into the turf
flighted, bit of spin and hits the splice as Chandimal defends
on the stumps, slower pace and can't get it away past midwicket
pushed through out of the front of the hand again, sliding on outside off, chopped through cover point
touch short, straightening outside off, driven off the back foot down the ground to long-off
full, dipping on off stump, dug out back to the bowler
length ball, Mathews shows some aggression early in the over, skips out and launches the ball up and over mid-off, doesn't quite carry all the way but bounces for four
on the stumps, tighter line and tapped to leg
straight line and worked squarer on the leg side for one
touch back of a length, hits the pads as Chandi plays across the line, drops into a gap
length outside off, possible a slower cutter from Plunkett, it bounces up past the outside edge as Mathews pushes at it
pitched up on the stumps, tapped short on the leg side
pushed through on the stumps, no turn and flicked to fine leg
too straight from Rashid and Mathews gets a bit of inside edge, deliberately played fine down the leg side and it outruns the fielder
tossed up and nudged short on the leg side
gets a bit of turn here, spinning away as Mathews plays forward, thick low edge past slip for one
length ball, played off the back foot down the ground to long-off
tossed up, slower and inviting Chandimal out, can't quite get to the pitch, though, and defends
fullish, maybe a touch slower, dobbed into the off side
pitched up on middle and leg, Mathews clears the front dog and batters it down the ground, not a long boundary and it clears the rope for a flat six
hitting the pitch hard, slightly back of a length, past the bat as Mathews hangs back
Mathews comes down the pitch, Plunkett digs it in, slightly ungainly swipe but it squirts through midwicket off the bottom edge
good length on the stumps, flamingo flick from Chandimal, in front of deep square and they get two
pitched up and driven to mid-off, who's slightly back and they scamper one comfortably
flicked off the pads into a gap and they come back for a second, the throw not quite good enough to trouble Chandimal
on the stumps and tapped to the leg side
floated up and heaved into a gap at midwicket, bit of a agricultural stroke but he gets it through for another welcome boundary
flighted outside off, tapped towards point
tossed up, goes down to sweep and the ball bounces up over the bat, think it hit the glove before ricocheting away off the pads
come across and punches one more through the covers
on the pads and flicked through backward square
bowling over the wicket, good length on middle and leg, Mathews defends
pitched up and driven, fine of mid-off and Plunkett lets it through his hands/legs as he comes across, long-on has to tidy up
middle-and-off line, defended towards the bowler
Willey making sure not to offer any width, again played back down the track
length ball on the stumps, 80mph and jabbed through square leg off the back foot
more runs conceded, although he's a touch unlucky, Mathews prodding tentatively and getting a thick edge that falls short of slip and then scuttles away to the boundary
pushed through outside off, swatted through the covers to the sweeper
floated up, Chandimal plinks it to short extra cover
googly and Chandi is in place to sweep with the spin, Buttler anticipated but couldn't get in the way of a firm connection and that will be a second boundary in the over
good length, straightening on middle and leg, turned down square
pushed through on a length outside off stump, steered through point for another single
good length outside off stump, drops back and glides one to third man
on the stumps, shuffles into line and clips through midwicket

slightly streaky but that's another four and SL will take them however they come, Chandimal flicking across the line at a leg-stump cutter, gets an edge on to his thigh pad and it runs away past short fine leg
pitched up and drawing the drive, sliced down to third man
good length on the stumps, Mathews inside-edges on to his pads
closes the face and nudges to leg, midwicket has to dive to stop and they take the single
pitched up full and tailing in towards off, Mathews digs it out on to his boot
length ball, punched back to Jordan's left and he sticks out a hand to stop it
fired down the leg side
full and straight, 87mph and clipped to midwicket of the toe of the bat
length ball outside off, tapped down towards extra cover
slightly back of a length, over off stump and dropped down in front of backward point for a hard-run single
full length and driven to mid-off, who dives forward to underarm at the stumps... but misses. Chandimal, whose hamstrings must be plenty warm now, was probably just in
on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
pushed across on off stump, guided to backward point on the bounce, can't get a run there
full length, driven to mid-off and they set off straight away, easy single
touch shorter, maybe a cutter from Willey, steered to backward point from the crease
length ball, Mathews skips out and flat-bats it down the ground to long-off - only a single again
length on off stump, closes the face and turns to midwicket - Willey keeping it tight
back of a length, sliding down the leg side and helped on its way, fine leg has to dive to cut it off
length ball, he advances and chips over the covers, lands short of the man in the deep
full and drifting on to the pads, clipped through square leg - that's Chandimal's fifty, his second the series
shortish, at the body, fended away through square
back of a length outside off, drops back and sends a cut to backward point
very full, slower ball dipping outside off, plonked back down the ground for one

starts with a short ball on the hips and Chandimal treats it like a cream bun, takes a couple of bites with a flick past short fine leg, who does well to give chase and reel it in just ahead of the rope
shortish outside off, dabbed down behind point for one
good length, Mathews softly drops it into the off side but thinks better of the single as Woakes fields in his follow through
back of a length on middle and leg, miscued short to the on side, again Woakes chase after it
full on off, flicked to midwicket, another dot
shortish outside off stump, 84mph and defended down into the pitch - Woakes finishes off a decent over
dug in short and Chandimal swats a pull through backward square leg for one
short of a length on the stumps, rides the bounce and taps down into the leg side
full but sliding to leg, misdirected yorker, scrambled seam and egged on its way down to fine leg for four more to Chandimal's score
stays in the crease and dabs to backward point
pitched up full and straight, this time he clears the front leg and wallops back past the bowler - but straight to mid-on and hit too well to allow a single

short ball, flapped into the leg side, big top edge and Bairstow comes hurtling in off the boundary attempting to take a sensational catch... he slides forward but can't quite get his hands underneath and it bounces away. Would have been a worldie if he had got there
retreats to leg to make room in the covers and Bairstow has to run around at point to gather
stand-and-deliver floggage off a good length. Inside-edges into the crease, but the intent is plain
walloped through the leg-side, the sweeper is on hand to limit the damage
worked to leg with more finesse, or rather less lack of finesse. Still gagging to give it some humpty ...

very full, too straight to work to leg with a cross-batted wipe. Chris Jordan steadies himself at third man and that was never going to be dropped! Understandable ambition from Chandimal but he picked the wrong shot for the wrong ball
tight line, tapped back down the track
very full and straight, Prasanna defends cautiously to leg to get his eye in...
short and effective, Seekkuga wanted the wide on height, but the umpire reckons that was fair as it whistled past his lugholes
up on the toes, pushed to cover
short again but this time too leg-sided
short, smashed high and ugly high, high behind square ... but fine leg can't get there! Cleaned up on the bounce to save the four

flipped off the pads, high and hideous to Jonny Bairstow at deep midwicket. The intent was fine, but he got right underneath the shot and Plunkett has another key breakthrough. He's made a big impact today in his three spells.
on the hip, worked fine
worked to leg, thinking about the two, but thinking better of it
round the wicket to the left-hander, who is well beaten with a loose poke outside off
a bit of an inside-edged poke through the leg-side, not really where he was aiming but it'll do to get off the mark
back over the wicket, good delivery, nibbling a fraction from just back of a length
tapped to mid-on, Root smothers with a dive. He's moving a little less gingerly now. Sunblock does the trick after all
fenced to midwicket. That's a tight over
prodded on the up into the covers
short, flizzing down the leg-side
well bowled, well played! Mathews retreated to leg, Plunkett followed him, and the resulting shot was blocked on the up into no-man's land at cow corner. Oddly effective
solidly forward
jabbed defence out to point, from round the wicket
poked into the covers, standing tall
solid line and length, Willey's boot blocks the ball as Mathews punches down the track
Willey's boot back in the action again! Fuller and straighter, and blocked by an outstretched leg
down the leg side, as the rain gets a touch more intense...
turned into the leg side
smashed through the leg side, just tenderised off a good length, working with the angle into his pads. Shot
a compact drive and a sharp single to mid-off. The shy comes in but they are safely home
up on the toes and dabbed to midwicket
clipped to leg, working the singles
round the wicket, pulled down into the leg-side, behind square for a quick single
clipped fine, good running between the wickets as Mathews continues to stretch his 'strings
tight off-stump line, Mathews clips solidly to long on to bring up a vital half-century
banged in short, cramped for room
patted into the covers, the end of an excellent penetrative spell. Three wickets in three lively bursts
clipped down to long-on for another single
battered high and hard over wide long-on for a maximum that is dropped in the crowd! The glory moment, lost forever! Picked up the good length and slotted it through the line
forward and defended
slow full-toss, and loosely patted just over the head of short cover! That was Willey's knuckle-ball and it was knuckle-headed cricket all round!
fuller and straighter, flipped up to long-on
clipped round the corner, scampered single to short fine leg
good line and length, Tharanga pats back to the bowler
shorter and wider, avoiding Tharanga's strength on the sweep. Slapped out to the cover sweeper
tapped to backward square, a frantic single, sharp shy, and this might have been close if Buttler had gathered cleanly...
heaved into the leg-side ... but bounces inches short of Hales at cow corner
worked off the pads
thrashed on the up, into space in the covers. No enough connection to clear the rope, but just enough to avoid the fielder rushing round to intercept
smashed across the line as Jordan drops back of a length, a steepling top-edge, and Buttler makes good ground on the leg side to snaffle a vital chance!
short and pulled out to deep midwicket
outside off, good variety as Jordan bangs a cross-seamer into the deck. Under-edged cut through to the keeper
tight and full, attacking the pads and worked to short midwicket
shorter and wider, but not wide enough to free the arms for the cut. Climbs through to the keeper for another precious dot
attempted yorker, clipped to leg, that's a fine comeback over
twirly line and length, turning leg to off and patted to cover off the back foot
low full toss, slapped down to wide long-on
thumped back to the bowler
down on one knee, a googly is mis-swept to short third man, Root's shy comes in to the keeper's end, but both men were backing up at the non-striker's!
another legbreak, patted to cover

turns sharply, and deflected to short third man. No run remotely possible there, but this is excruciatingly tight as Shanaka is sent back, quite rightly, by Tharanga. Buttler whips off the bails and there is a solitary frame in this decision. And after a long deliberation, Bruce Oxenford says out! In all honesty, I'm not convinced the bail was entirely out of its groove, but it's a total judgement call when things get that tight. And the worst bit of judgement was the attempted run in the first place!
pulled fiercely through midwicket. That's the intent Sri Lanka are looking for!
tight line and worked into the leg-side
attacking the shins with a fuller length, flicked to midwicket
worked down to mid-on, the rain is settling in a bit now, but still no thought of taking the players off
thumped out to deep point, Hales tidies up
set himself for the short ball but Jordan drags his line wide to draw a toe-ended slap into the covers
low full toss, not quite the yorker, but effective enough, clipped to midwicket
up on the toes, worked out to cover
bouncer, and ducked. But too high as Tim Robinson, the square leg umpire, signals to his colleague, Paul Reiffel
fuller length, and zipping past an ambitious drill through the covers
open face, squeezes into the covers for another single
England hanging back to settle for the singles. Root at extra cover cleans up
low full toss, struck hard and straight but long-off slides round to limit the damage

lofted high in the air over extra cover - Root and Hales sprint back but can't quite reach it as they come close to tangling with each other's limbs, like a defender and striker chasing a through ball
crunched into the covers but limited to a single

very full, very straight, and though the lbw appeal is turned down, the fact that a run is given persuades Morgan to review. Because he's convinced there was no bat involved ... but it seems there was just the thinnest slice of splinter of inside-edge ... not out
thumped down the ground, another single
very full, drilled on the up to long-on
crunched into the leg-side, but that's another fine over from Jordan. Full or short, he has varied his line and length impeccably
clipped firmly to deep midwicket where Roy and Hales once again work in perfect harmony to slide and save the boundary
on the pads, a bit of a let-off as the ball thuds behind square off the pad
flogged up and over the leg-side, Root - still not moving completely freely - jogs round to gather
low full toss, crunched behind square with an energetic fling of willow through the line
short but not that short, pulled ambitiously through the leg-side, Root and Bairstow circle beneath it, Bairstow makes the call, guzzles the chance, and Sri Lanka's faltering charge falters once more
bowled him! Line and length, nipping off the deck, trimming the bails on the top of middle stump and Thranga has a wipe across the line and connects with thin air!
full length, nipping in, deflecting into the covers off the pad
hoofed up and over the bowler's head, lots of sound and fury but the ball barely goes anywhere
cracked out to the leg-side
clobbered into the covers, a big wind-up but he clothed his shot
turns his stance around in an attempt to flick over fine leg, but no contact

yorker length slower ball, slapped without power into the deep. Jordan's shy is unusually poor and so Sri Lanka survive a last-ball run-out, but that does not feel like enough runs for a pitch like this

inn2.comm: starts on a shortish length over off stump, Roy cramped for room blocks down the track
short and a touch wide, drops back and frees the arms to chop one past backward point

back of a length, Hales plays away from his body - and nicks to the keeper! Big, thick deflection, the ball skidding on, Hales trying to force off the back foot. From an unbeaten hundred to a golden duck in the space of two days! SL have the early breakthrough they needed
back of a length, 82mph on middle stump, blocked down to the leg side
shortish, Root attempts to pull and splices it in the air towards midwicket, lands short of the fielder
shuffles across the stumps and taps down to the on side
good length in the channel, Roy steps out and lets it through to thud into the gloves
comes forward, opens the face and runs a length ball down to short third man
tight lines from Angie, nibbling in a fraction, defended back down the pitch
on the stumps, again pushed back down the track
goes a little straighter, this time Root turns the wrists and deflects a couple through square leg
come forward on off stump and taps in front of square
back of a length outside off, Roy swats a cut down to third man
slightly short of a good length, on off stump but whipped away through square leg for a couple
back of the net! Root gets a bit of width this time and hammers a cut through point the fence for England's first boundary
tighter line from Lakmal, blocked back down the pitch
gets forward and blocks into the covers
shortish outside off, Root chops down on it, the ball bounces towards point
length ball, sliding in with the arm, clipped off the pads through square leg
drops a touch short, width for Root to happily slap a couple more through backward point
on the stumps, defended back on the leg side
stays back in the crease and glances one of Mathews' dobblers through backward square leg
touch fuller, 77mph outside off, Roy leans on to the front foot, opens the face to guide one more to third man
wicket-to-wicket line of attack, blocked back towards mid-on
